newsitem.title: INDIA: GEC Alsthom, Usha sign power plant MOU.
newsitem.headline: GEC Alsthom, Usha sign power plant MOU.

text.p: Anglo-French joint venture GEC Alsthom signed a memorandum of understanding with India's Usha (India) Ltd on Wednesday to examine the possibility of building a power plant.
Timothy Fisher, GEC Alsthom project development director, told Reuters he estimated a plant of this size would cost around $100 million to build.
The proposed 80 megawatt combined cycle gas turbine captive power plant would supply the Indian company's steel plant at Jagdishpur in the north Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.

Fisher said the feasibility study should be completed by September and his company would expect financial closure within another 12 months. The naphtha-fuelled plant would take two years to complete after financial closure.
GEC Alsthom is jointly owned by General Electric Co Plc and Alcatel Alsthom.
